trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> types to UI Automation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Gets the access key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey"></xref>.
The access key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref>.
Gets the control type for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType.MenuItem"></xref> enumeration value.

Gets the collection of child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren"></xref>.
The collection of child elements.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName"></xref>.
A string that contains "MenuItem".
Gets the text label of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName"></xref>.
The name property can be thought of as the string of text that a user would use to explain which control is being referred to.

It is important to have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.
The string that contains the label.
Gets the control pattern for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
If one of the following cases occurs, this method returns the current <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> object.

`patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> has child <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects.

`patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> does not have child <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects.

`patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.MenuItemAutomationPeer> has its checkable property set to `true`.

If `patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName>, this method returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider> interface.
One of the enumeration values.
An object that supports the control pattern if patternInterface is a supported value; otherwise, `null`.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The state (expanded or collapsed) of the control.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The toggle state of the control.
